These grants are critically important. In 2019 a sixty-eight-year-old man named Yosef Lifshutz was shot six times in the leg in a hate crime. Just this week, antisemitic fliers were left outside of hundreds of homes in Miami Beach.

This work has made Florida‚Äôs non-profits, faith-based organizations, and houses of worship eligible for a separate set of critical security grants. Last year we doubled this funding and provided $6.5 million for organizations in South Florida and millions more across the state.
As a member of the House Homeland Security Committee, my #1 priority in Congress has been to strengthen federal security programs that have kept Floridians safe.

Rabbi Charlie Cytron-Walker from Colleyville, Texas said that ‚Äúit was years of security training‚Äù that helped them escape the hostage situation last week. I have been a champion for this funding, and we should expand it.
